title: partialwrap: Wrappers of external executables and Python functions for functools.partial

creators.affiliation: Institut National de Recherche pour l'Agriculture, l'Alimentation et l'Environnement - INRAE, Nancy, France
creators.name: Matthias Cuntz

description:
partialwrap is a Python library providing easy wrapper functions to use with Python's functools.partial. Partial's ingenious mechanism allows to use even very complex functions with many arguments and keyword arguments with routines that need functions in the simple form func(x). This includes Python's builtin map function, the minimizers in scipy.optimize, and plenty of third-party modules such as emcee or pyeee. partialwrap allows to use any external executable as well as any Python function with arbitrary arguments and keywords to be used with functools.partial. It also allows to use the executables or functions with easy parallelization of code with, for example, the parallel map function of the multiprocessing module or via the Message Passing Interface (MPI)

 

The current release is a major rewrite of the documentation and the docstrings, being more legible and providing more hands-on examples.
